instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> death no green light
threads.message:
hello friends, i am just working on that board, no watermarks to see but could be cleaned, that man bought it in ebay.


i figured out 

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is there

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 0V

resistance <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> is like expected

acin pin3 is 0V

replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

got now green light no fanspin


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.22V, so i think a not working smc

replaced the smc i got now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.55V should be ok, still no fan spin

no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

measured short to gnd

pulled l7260 out

short to gnd on pin 2

injecting now 3.3V on pin 2

voltage breaks down to 2.4V and coming 3.2A more ampere on that labor power unit not possible

nothing is warm on the board 

need some help how to diagnostic now best way

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> death no green light
threads.message:
There is no way to find that short. Use your lips to feel the board, at 3.2A something must warm up.
Also there are already many failures on this board that suggest a power surge/spike. Looks like extensive damage everywhere. This will be a time waster board, but if you have nothing else to do go ahead.
I suspect the PCH at this point

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> death no green light
threads.message:
:-) a time waster board. good name for that. May first guess was PCH as well. So after replacing is still not now needfull to replace the bios, on a later point only isnt it?

go to replace that now, after thate i will report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> death no green light
threads.message: Dont replace yet! First feel if it gets warm, that 3A must make something warm.
